## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to assist you in understanding Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I've been thinking about creating a new currency on the Verus network, and I was wondering what features can be enabled when launching a new currency?

**AI Assistant:**
When launching a new currency on the Verus network, it can be configured to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Additionally, the Verus import/export protocol makes it easy to integrate with other blockchains, and there are already bridges in progress to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens. Does that help?

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've also heard about the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology. What's the significance of that?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology allows Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. This technology enables all network blockchains to provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies. It's a really powerful feature!

**User:**
I've been playing around with the `sendcurrency` API, and I was wondering, how can I convert VRSCTEST to another currency using it?

**AI Assistant:**
You can convert VRSCTEST to another currency using the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"TESTCOIN"}]'
```
Give it a try and see how it works!

**User:**
That's helpful. What if I want to preconvert VRSCTEST to a new currency before it is active using the `sendcurrency` API?

**AI Assistant:**
You can preconvert VRSCTEST to a new currency before it is active using the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'
```
Just keep in mind that you need to specify the `preconvert` option and provide a refund address.

**User:**
I've got it. How can I send VRSCTEST from a single address to a single recipient using the `sendcurrency` API?

**AI Assistant:**
You can send VRSCTEST from a single address to a single recipient using the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'
```
Just specify the source address, destination address, and amount, and you're good to go!

**User:**
One last question: How can I send VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to multiple recipients using the `sendcurrency` API?

**AI Assistant:**
You can send VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to multiple recipients using the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'
```
Just use the `*` wildcard to specify all wallet funds, and provide a list of recipients with their respective amounts.

What features can be enabled when launching a new currency on the Verus network?

When launching a new currency on the Verus network, it can be configured to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Additionally, the Verus import/export protocol makes it easy to integrate with other blockchains, and there are already bridges in progress to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens.

Currencies can be launched to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Verus import/export protocol was designed to make integration with other block chains provable and easy, and there are already external bridges in progress that expect to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens, where currencies can be sent between Verus and ETH, expressed as Verus currencies on the Verus network, and exposed automatically on ETH as an ERC20 token.# Preparing for Multi-chain, Dynamic Merge Mining While this 0.7.1 testnet enables on-chain token currency definition, the same advances will soon be available on the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology which was running on testnet last year. When enabled, this will make it possible for Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. All network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies as well.## Sending and Converting Currency **Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds. **Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]' ``` **Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]' ``` **Converting VRSCTEST to another currency, TESTCOIN:** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"TESTCOIN"}]' ``` **Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]' ```## Defining a Currency

What is the significance of the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology?

The Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology allows Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. This technology enables all network blockchains to provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies.

Currencies can be launched to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Verus import/export protocol was designed to make integration with other block chains provable and easy, and there are already external bridges in progress that expect to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens, where currencies can be sent between Verus and ETH, expressed as Verus currencies on the Verus network, and exposed automatically on ETH as an ERC20 token.# Preparing for Multi-chain, Dynamic Merge Mining While this 0.7.1 testnet enables on-chain token currency definition, the same advances will soon be available on the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology which was running on testnet last year. When enabled, this will make it possible for Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. All network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies as well.## Sending and Converting Currency **Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds. **Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]' ``` **Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]' ``` **Converting VRSCTEST to another currency, TESTCOIN:** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"TESTCOIN"}]' ``` **Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:** ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]' ```## Defining a Currency
